intro: Anagallis latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of pink or white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Anagallis latifolia is a perennial herb that can spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
